facts.text: The MLS Golden Boot award was first introduced in the 2005 season.
The MLS Golden Boot award replaced the MLS Scoring Champion Award, which was awarded from the league's inception in 1996 until 2004.
Prior to 2005, the MLS Scoring Champion was determined using a point system that awarded two points for a goal and one point for an assist.
Since 2005, the MLS Golden Boot has been awarded to the player who scores the most goals outright, with ties broken by assists.
Carlos Vela scored the highest number of goals in a single MLS season with 34 goals in 2019.

Taylor Twellman was the first player to win the MLS Golden Boot under its current criteria in 2005.
Bradley Wright-Phillips and Chris Wondolowski are both two-time MLS Golden Boot winners.
Christian Benteke won the MLS Golden Boot in 2024 with 23 goals.
